basics.name: Rolando Cadiz
basics.label: Student
basics.summary:
I am studying Computer Science at the University of Hawai'i at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2026 with a B.S. in Computer Science. 
    My career interests are in software development.

interests.name: Integrating software into real, usable products

work.summary:
Tanaka of Tokyo is a teppanyaki restaurant in the heart of Waikiki, serving guests visiting Hawai'i from all over the world. I primarily serve and occasionally 
      help buss tables and handle check/cash transactions for other servers.
highlights: Ensure high guest satisfaction while working in a fast-paced environment.
Communicate with the front staff team to coordinate strategies to maintain reservation times.
Handle cash and credit card transactions
Work in organized teams to clear and clean tables.

work.summary: Delivered orders to customers within specified deadlines and helped the in-store staff with making customer orders
highlights: Deliver customer orders in a timely fashion
Answer phones and take customer orders with immense precision.

awards.title: Hawai'i Veterans Memorial Undergraduate Scholarship
awards.summary: A merit-based scholarship for students who demonstrate financial need and who maintain a GPA of 2.5 or higher

awards.title: Chris and May Hui Scholarship Endowment
awards.summary: A merit-based scholarship for students who maintain a GPA of 3.0 or higher

awards.title: CNS Native Hawaiian Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to native Hawaiian students who maintain a minimum GPA of 3.0
